validators.errorMsg: Max host length is 4096
Proxy Host should not have special characters
Max length of username is 50
Max length of password is 8192

options.saveValidator: function(formData) { if(!formData.proxy_enabled || formData.proxy_enabled === '0') {return true; } if(!formData.proxy_url) { return 'Proxy Host can not be empty'; } if(!formData.proxy_port) { return 'Proxy Port can not be empty'; } return true; }

subDescription.text:
Configuration page - Ingesting data from to Splunk Cloud? Have you tried the new Splunk Data Manager yet?
Data Manager makes AWS data ingestion simpler, more automated and centrally managed for you, while co-existing with AWS and/or Kinesis TAs.
Read our [[blogPost]] to learn more about Data Manager and it's availability on your Splunk Cloud instance.

entity.help: The name of the object to query for.

entity.label: Object Fields

validators.errorMsg: Max length of text input is 8192

entity.help: Object fields from which to collect data. Delimit multiple fields using a comma.

entity.label: Order By

validators.errorMsg: Max length of text input is 8192

entity.help: The datetime field by which to query results in ascending order for indexing.

entity.label: Use existing data input?
entity.help: Data input already exists. Select `No` if you want to reset the data collection.

entity.label: Query Start Date

validators.errorMsg: Invalid date and time format

entity.help:
The datetime after which to query and index records, in this format: "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.000z".
Defaults to 90 days earlier from now.
entity.tooltip: Changing this parameter may result in gaps or duplication in data collection.

entity.label: Limit

validators.errorMsg: Max length of text input is 8192

entity.help: The maximum number of results returned by the query.

entity.label: Query Start Date

validators.errorMsg: Invalid date and time format

entity.help:
The date and time, in "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.000z" format, after which to query and index records. 
The default is 90 days before today.
entity.tooltip: Changing this parameter may result in gaps or duplication in data collection.

subDescription.text:
Input page - Ingesting data from to Splunk Cloud? Have you tried the new Splunk Data Manager yet?
Data Manager makes AWS data ingestion simpler, more automated and centrally managed for you, while co-existing with AWS and/or Kinesis TAs.
Read our [[blogPost]] to learn more about Data Manager and it's availability on your Splunk Cloud instance.
